Questions: Is the DAO 's Gini Coefficient for economic tokens less than or equal to fifty percent ( <= 50%)?
Is the Banzhaf Index for each individual member less than or equal to twenty-five percent (<= 25.0%)?
Does the DAO explicitly state that private communication channels are for sensitive or confidential matters?
Does the DAO explicitly require members to verify that they have a unique digital identity?
Does the DAO have any leadership roles?
Does the DAO have any management roles?
Does the DAO require members to adhere to a standard of conduct, such as described in a code of conduct?
Does the DAO provide a glossary of internal terms?
Does the DAO use a participatory governance model?
Does the DAO have an explicitly defined dispute resolution mechanism?
Does the DAO have a shared ownership model?
Does the DAO have a well-defined procedure for how members can take defined leadership or management roles?
Does the DAO provide members multifaceted activities to receive rewards?
Does the DAO have leadership from multiple geographic regions?
Does the DAO have members in multiple geographic regions?
Does the DAO have managers from multiple geographic regions?
Does the DAO have a collective treasury (or multisig account)?
Does the DAO have currencies recognizing value beyond financial relations, such as labor, contributor well-being, or environmental impact?
Does the DAO have a collective membership mark to signify membership in the DAO?
Does the DAO redistribute profits/surplus on a basis other than capital holdings?
Does the DAO have any accountability mechanisms that subject the power of leaders and managers to the members?
Does the DAO have an amendment procedure for its rules, procedures or policies?
Does the DAO have a decision-making matrix?
Does the DAO have metrics beyond governance and finance, such as contributor well-being or happiness?
Does the DAO have separate tokens for governance and economic rights?
Does the DAO not make governance tokens tradeable?
Does the DAO provide education and training opportunities for members to meaningful participate in governance?
Does the DAO publish content on its activites in its' public channels?
Does the DAO make an explicit, clearly articulated statement of its purpose, values and norms?
Does the DAO provide an organizational analytics dashboard?
Does the DAO make its governance activities (e.g., proposals, decisions) publicly accessible at free to low-cost?
Does the DAO make its organizational documents (bylaws, policies, strategic plan, etc.) publicly accessible at free to low-cost?
Does the DAO make its technologies open source or source available, and publicly accessible at free to low-cost?
Does the DAO explicitly report whether any Web3 tools it uses, internally or externally, have been audited?
Does the DAO explicitly state that it operates on, or interacts with, more than one (1) blockchain?
Does the DAO explicitly describe it’s financial incentive or compensation structure for contributors?
Does the DAO have any planned transactions with another DAO?
Does the DAO have any current transactions with another DAO?
Does the DAO currently use any Web3 organizational technology for business-to-business operations?
Does the DAO currently use any Web3 organizational technology for treasury management?
Does the DAO currently use any Web3 organizational technology for contribution-tracking?
Does the DAO currently use any Web3 organizational technology for decision-making?
Does the DAO explicitly acknowledge the possible vulnerabilities of algorithmic decision-making?
Does the DAO educate its members on the development and use of algorithms, as they pertain to the DAO?
Does the DAO explicitly consider the short- and long-term social consequences of the algorithmic systems in the development and use of algorithms?
